body_html:
When I did the split, I included the implementation rules explicitly from Android build targets. My hope was that Android would then just build without extra config options. It's possible I missed some (un-tested?) targets.

So one solution would be to figure out which header-only rules don't have their implementation rules included and then add the implementation rules explicitly (I might be able to tell you based on which symbols are undefined). But building with --config=monolithic does accomplish the same thing. I don't have a strong preference.

body:
When I did the split, I included the implementation rules explicitly from Android build targets. My hope was that Android would then just build without extra config options. It's possible I missed some (un-tested?) targets.

So one solution would be to figure out which header-only rules don't have their implementation rules included and then add the implementation rules explicitly (I might be able to tell you based on which symbols are undefined). But building with --config=monolithic does accomplish the same thing. I don't have a strong preference.
